title: David Mitchell (footballer, born 1866)
text:
David Mitchell (29 April 1866 – 6 December 1948) was a Scottish <a href="association%20football">football</a> player, best known for his time with <a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a>.
Playing career.
Mitchell joined <a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a> from <a href="Kilmarnock%20F.C.">Kilmarnock</a> in September 1889. He was <a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a> captain and won two <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish Football League</a> championships (the shared <a href="1890%E2%80%9391%20Scottish%20Football%20League">1890–91</a> title and the <a href="perfect%20season">perfect season</a> of <a href="1898%E2%80%9399%20Scottish%20Division%20One">1898–99</a>), three <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a>s (<a href="1894%20Scottish%20Cup%20Final">1894</a>, <a href="1897%20Scottish%20Cup%20Final">1897</a> and <a href="1898%20Scottish%20Cup%20Final">1898</a>), four <a href="Glasgow%20Cup">Glasgow Cup</a>s, two <a href="Glasgow%20Football%20League">Glasgow Football League</a>s and one <a href="Glasgow%20Merchants%20Charity%20Cup">Charity Cup</a>. He made 171 appearances for the club in the league and Scottish Cup plus the 1891 championship playoff with <a href="Dumbarton%20F.C.">Dumbarton</a>, scoring eight goals. Mitchell also won five Scotland caps.
Retirement.
He retired in 1900 and moved to <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a> to coach.
